name: Turkish Spiny Mouse
description: It has a sandy coloration with a light belly, large upright ears, and a bare scaly tail. The stiff hairs on its back are dark brown.
spread_note: A small area on the southern coast of Turkey
image_alt: Turkish spiny mouse, photo: Pavel Brandl, Prague Zoo
proportions: Body length 10 cm; tail length 8 cm
reproduction: Females are pregnant for 5–6 weeks, giving birth to 3–5 young.
attractions: Its lifestyle does not differ from other spiny mice species. Active mainly at night, it lives in groups, and other females assist in caring for the well-developed young. We still have little data on this spiny mouse’s life.
breeding: This spiny mouse reached European zoos through a single pregnant female caught in the wild. We have kept it at Prague Zoo since 1999, with the first individuals coming directly from Turkey.
